vibration

Class CoordProperty

  • java.lang.Object
    • vibration.CoordProperty

  • public class CoordProperty
extends java.lang.Object
    Calculates the properties of vibrational coordinates.
    Since:
    Sindo 3.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Kiyoshi Yagi

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CoordProperty()
      Constructor
      CoordProperty(CoordinateData coordinate)
      Construct the class with the specified coordinate

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void appendCoordinate(CoordinateData coordinate)
      Append the vibrational coordinate
      double[][] getCenterOfVibration()
      Returns a center of vibrational mode defined as,
      r_i = Sum_{a=1}^{N} p_a^{(i)} r_a,
      p_a^{(i)} = mu_i/ma Sum_{xx=x,y,z} L_{axx,i}^2
      double[] getInfrared(double[][] dipoleDerv)
      Returns the infrared intensity
      double getPij(int i, int j)
      Returns Pij = |r[i]-r[j]|, where r[i] is the center of the i-th coordinate.
      double getPijk(int i, int j, int k) 
      double[] getRaman(double[][] polarizabilityDerv)
      Returns the raman activity
      double[] getReducedMass()
      Returns a reduced mass associated with the vibrational coordinates.
      double[] getVariantOfVibration()
      Returns a variant of vibrational modes defined as,
      dr = sqrt(Sum_{a=1}^N p_a^(i) |r_a - r_i|^2),
      p_a^{(i)} = mu_i/ma Sum_{xx=x,y,z} L_{axx,i}^2

      • CoordProperty

        public CoordProperty()
        Constructor

      • CoordProperty

        public CoordProperty(CoordinateData coordinate)
        Construct the class with the specified coordinate
        Parameters:
        coordinate - the vibrational coordinate

    • Method Detail

      • appendCoordinate

        public void appendCoordinate(CoordinateData coordinate)
        Append the vibrational coordinate
        Parameters:
        coordinate - the vibrational coordinate

      • getReducedMass

        public double[] getReducedMass()
        Returns a reduced mass associated with the vibrational coordinates. The reduced mass is defined as,
        1/mu_i = Sum_{a=1}^N 1/ma Sum_{xx=x,y,z} L_{axx,i}^2
        Returns:
        The reduced mass for all modes in emu.

      • getCenterOfVibration

        public double[][] getCenterOfVibration()
        Returns a center of vibrational mode defined as,
        r_i = Sum_{a=1}^{N} p_a^{(i)} r_a,
        p_a^{(i)} = mu_i/ma Sum_{xx=x,y,z} L_{axx,i}^2
        Returns:
        The center of vibration for all modes in bohr

      • getVariantOfVibration

        public double[] getVariantOfVibration()
        Returns a variant of vibrational modes defined as,
        dr = sqrt(Sum_{a=1}^N p_a^(i) |r_a - r_i|^2),
        p_a^{(i)} = mu_i/ma Sum_{xx=x,y,z} L_{axx,i}^2
        Returns:
        The variant of vibration for all modes in bohr

      • getInfrared

        public double[] getInfrared(double[][] dipoleDerv)
        Returns the infrared intensity
        Parameters:
        dipoleDerv - double[Nat3][xyz] dipole derivatives in mass-weight Cartesian (atomic unit)
        Returns:
        IR intensity (km/mol)

      • getRaman

        public double[] getRaman(double[][] polarizabilityDerv)
        Returns the raman activity
        Parameters:
        polarizabilityDerv - double[Nat3][6] polarizability tensor derivatives in mass-weight Cartesian coordinates (atomic unit)
        Returns:
        Raman activity (Angs^4/amu)

      • getPij

        public double getPij(int i,
                     int j)
        Returns Pij = |r[i]-r[j]|, where r[i] is the center of the i-th coordinate.
        Parameters:
        i - the i-th coordinate
        j - the j-th coordinate
        Returns:
        Pij

      • getPijk

        public double getPijk(int i,
                      int j,
                      int k)
